meaning: Yīn: ① overcast or cloudy (weather); ② shady side, not facing the sun; ③ the Yin principle in Yin–Yang (dark, passive, feminine); ④ hidden, implicit, secret; ⑤ negative (electric charge); ⑥ the moon; ⑦ genitalia; ⑧ a Chinese surname (Yin).
components:
阴 = ⿰阝(月)
- 阝 (阜, fù): mound, hill, place or area. On the left it often relates to places, city areas, or terrain.
- 月 (yuè): originally “moon”, also used as a component related to body/flesh or things not in direct sunlight.
Together: a place (阝) under the moon/away from the sun (月) → the shady, dark, hidden side → ‘yīn’.

examples.zh: 今天是阴天，可能会下雨。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān shì yīntiān, kěnéng huì xiàyǔ.
examples.en: Today is overcast; it might rain.

examples.en: The balance of Yin and Yang is very important for health.

meaning: Because; due to; on account of. Used to introduce a reason or cause, often paired with 后面/所以 (suǒyǐ, “so/therefore”) to show the result.
components: 因: Written as ⿴囗大 — 囗 is an enclosing border, like a boundary or box; 大 is a big person with arms stretched wide. Together, it suggests something confined or caused by a situation. 为: A standalone character, often linked to “to do, to act, for the sake of.” In 因为, it helps express the idea of acting or happening for a reason. Combined, 因为 literally feels like “for this cause/act,” i.e. “because.”

examples.zh: 因为下雨，所以我带了伞。
examples.pinyin: Yīnwèi xià yǔ, suǒyǐ wǒ dài le sǎn.
examples.en: Because it’s raining, I brought an umbrella.

meaning: To swim; the activity or sport of swimming, moving through water using your body and limbs.
components:
游泳 is made of two characters, both with the water radical 氵 on the left, showing it’s about water.
- 游 (yóu): ⿰氵斿. 氵 is the water radical. 斿 shows the sound and originally relates to something floating/wandering. Together, 游 suggests moving or roaming in/near water.
- 泳 (yǒng): ⿰氵永. 氵 again means water. 永 (yǒng) means “forever/eternal” and also gives the sound. Imagine 永 as a body stretching smoothly through water—continuous, flowing movement in water.

examples.en: He can’t swim, so he’s very afraid of deep water.

meaning: Right side; the side or direction to the right of something or someone.
components: 右: Composed of ⿸𠂇 and 口. 右 originally suggests a hand or action by the right side of the mouth, and it means “right (side)”. 边: Composed of ⿺辶 and 力. 辶 is the “walking/movement” radical, suggesting a path or side, and 力 means “strength, power”. Together, 边 indicates an edge or side where movement happens. 右 + 边 literally means the side on the right.

meaning: Fish; also used in names of various aquatic animals that aren’t biologically fish (like abalone, crocodiles, and octopus). It can also be a surname (Yu). The common classifier for fish is 条 (tiáo) or 尾 (wěi).
components: 鱼 is historically written as ⿳𠂊田一. Think of it as a stylized picture of a fish: the top strokes (𠂊) suggest the fish’s head, 田 looks like the patterned body or scales, and 一 at the bottom is the tail or the water line. Altogether it’s a simplified pictograph of a fish.

meaning: 1) Yuan – Chinese currency unit; 2) first, original, primary; 3) basic, fundamental, constituent part; 4) meta-, abstract ‘source’ or ‘level’; 5) mathematical argument/variable; 6) an era name in a reign; 7) the Yuan dynasty; 8) surname Yuan.
components: 元 is written as ⿱一兀: top 一 means “one” or “first”; below 兀 originally shows a high, flat surface. Together they suggest the ‘first, original, basic level’—the starting platform for everything, which fits meanings like ‘primary’ and ‘basic unit of money’.

meaning: 远 mainly means “far; distant; remote; by far; much (in comparison).” In classical Chinese, the reading yuàn means “to distance oneself from; to keep away from.”
components: 远 is ⿺辶元. 辶 (chuò) is the “walk/movement” radical, suggesting walking, roads, or travel. 元 (yuán) means “origin; beginning; primary.” Put together: starting to walk from the origin and going on and on → far, distant.

meaning: 运动 means physical movement or exercise (sports, working out), as well as broader movement or motion (like objects in physics). It can also mean a large-scale social or political movement or campaign.
components:
运: ⿺辶云. The 辶 (walk/movement) radical suggests walking, traveling, moving. 云 (cloud) hints at something drifting or moving in the air. Together, 运 has the idea of moving, transporting, or ‘movement in motion.’
动: ⿰云力. On the left, 云 (cloud) again; on the right, 力 (strength, force). Put them together and you get ‘cloud + power’ → applying force so that things move, i.e., to move, to act.

meaning: again; once more; to do over; further; from this point on; (before adjectives) more; then/only then (after something happens); no matter how (when followed by 也 or 都); also used to introduce additional points; in literary use, to reappear or occur again.
components: 再 is written as ⿱一冉: top 一 means “one” or “a single time.” Below is 冉 (rǎn), which originally shows the sun slowly rising. Put together, 再 suggests something happening one time, then slowly coming up to happen again—so it means “again, once more.”

meaning: Early morning; the period shortly after waking and after sunrise, but before the main part of the day begins. Used to talk about morning routines, greetings, and events that happen in the morning.
components:
早: Composed of 日 (sun) over 十, often seen as the sun appearing early on the horizon—so it means “early” or “morning.”
上: Written as ⺊ over 一, originally showing something going upward or being ‘on top,’ so it means “up, above.”
Together 早上 literally suggests the time when the sun is up early—‘early up’—which is the early morning.

meaning: 张 has two main uses: (1) Zhāng – a common Chinese surname; (2) zhāng – to open or spread (like a mouth, bow, wings, map, or net), and a classifier (measure word) for flat objects such as paper, tables, beds, photos, tickets, and votes.
components: 张 is ⿰弓长. 弓 means “bow” (as in bow and arrow), suggesting something bent that can be stretched. 长 means “long,” “to grow,” or “to extend.” Put together, a bow being pulled long and tight suggests stretching or spreading something out – which connects to the idea of opening and to the measure word for flat, spread-out things.

examples.pinyin: Qǐng gěi wǒ yì zhāng zhǐ.
examples.en: Please give me a sheet of paper.

meaning: 长 has two main readings: (cháng) “long; length; lasting; strong point; to be good at; surplus” and (zhǎng) “to grow; to develop; to increase; to enhance; elder; chief; head (of a group).” Context decides which reading and meaning is used.
components: 长 is a single-component character, originally a pictograph of long hair or a person with long, flowing features, conveying the idea of length and growth. From this core image come meanings like “long” (cháng) and “to grow / elder / chief” (zhǎng).

meaning: Husband; a woman’s male spouse. In modern Mandarin, 丈夫 is the standard, neutral word for one’s husband in most contexts (spoken and written), without implying age, status, or personality.
components:
丈: Originally depicts a unit of length (about 3.3 meters), extended to mean an adult male, a man of stature.
夫: Composed of 二 (two) and 人 (person), often interpreted as a man or adult male. Together, 丈夫 literally suggests a grown, full man—your formal, adult male partner, i.e., husband.

meaning: to try to find; to look for; to search for; to seek; to call on/visit someone; to locate; (of money) to give change, to return the balance.
components: 找 is ⿰扌戈. 扌 is the hand radical, related to actions done with the hand. 戈 is a halberd/spear-like weapon, symbolizing reaching out or probing. Together: a hand (扌) using a tool/weapon (戈) to reach out and search—so 找 means to look for, to find.

meaning:
着 is very common and has several related uses:
1) zháo – to be affected by, to catch (a disease, fire, feeling), to succeed in doing something, to fall asleep (e.g., 睡着了 ‘fell asleep’), result after a verb (e.g., 找着 ‘manage to find’).
2) zhe – aspect particle showing an ongoing action or continuous state (e.g., 门开着 ‘the door is (standing) open’).
3) zhuó – to put on / wear (clothes), to apply or use (e.g., 着力 ‘to exert force’).
4) zhāo – a move in chess, a trick or tactic (e.g., 招数 / 着数 ‘a move, a ploy’), also dialectal ‘okay; all right’ or ‘to put in; to add’.
components: Traditional component breakdown: ⿸羊目 – originally ‘sheep’ (羊) + ‘eye’ (目). Historically, this character is related to looking, noticing or being affected (an ‘eye’ on something), which later extended to ‘touching’ or ‘catching’ something, and then to a grammatical particle marking a state that continues. Modern learners often just remember the top as a variant of 羊 (sheep) and the bottom as 目 (eye). Think: a sheep’s eye that keeps watching something continuously → ongoing state / something being ‘touched’ or ‘affected’.

examples.zh: 他已经睡着了，不要吵他。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng shuìzháo le, búyào chǎo tā.
examples.en: He has already fallen asleep; don’t disturb him.

examples.zh: 门开着呢，你可以直接进来。
examples.pinyin: Mén kāizhe ne, nǐ kěyǐ zhíjiē jìnlái.
examples.en: The door is open; you can come straight in.

meaning: really; truly; indeed; real; true; genuine. Used both for emphasizing reality or sincerity (really, truly) and for describing something as authentic or not fake.
components: 真 is written as ⿱十具. Top: 十 (shí), literally “ten,” often used in characters to suggest completeness or something full. Bottom: 具 (jù), which originally shows a body or tools, meaning “to possess, to have, whole set.” Put together, 十 + 具 gives the idea of having everything fully and clearly present—nothing missing or fake—so it means “real, true, genuine.”

examples.zh: 这幅画是真的吗？
examples.pinyin: Zhè fú huà shì zhēn de ma?
examples.en: Is this painting real?

examples.zh: 我真不知道该说什么。

meaning: 正在 means “to be in the middle of doing something” or “currently …-ing.” It marks an action that is happening right now, emphasizing that it is ongoing at this moment.
components: 正 (zhèng): written as ⿱一止 – the top stroke 一 suggests something straight or correct; 止 means “to stop” or a “foot.” Together, 正 carries ideas of “upright, correct, just now.” 在 (zài): written as ⿸③土 – the left side is a shelter-like component, and 土 means “earth, ground.” 在 means “to be located at; to exist at a place or time.” Combined, 正在 literally suggests “right (now) at (a time/place),” i.e., an action happening at this very moment.

examples.zh: 我正在吃饭，等一下再跟你说。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèngzài chīfàn, děng yīxià zài gēn nǐ shuō.
examples.en: I am eating right now; I’ll talk to you later.

examples.zh: 他们正在开会，不方便接电话。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhèngzài kāihuì, bù fāngbiàn jiē diànhuà.
examples.en: They are having a meeting right now, so it’s not convenient to answer the phone.

examples.zh: 外面正在下雨，别忘了带伞。
examples.pinyin: Wàimiàn zhèngzài xià yǔ, bié wàngle dài sǎn.
examples.en: It is raining outside right now; don’t forget to bring an umbrella.

memoryStory: Imagine a super strict robot judge named 正 standing on one straight line 一, stomping his foot 止 and shouting, “Right now! Right now!” under a tiny roof 在 on the ground 土. Whenever he yells, whatever you’re doing at that place is 正在 happening at this very moment.
imagePrompt: A futuristic city street in the rain, frozen mid‑action: a person halfway through a bite of food, another mid‑step, cars paused mid‑drive. Above them, glowing holographic characters hover, showing a timeline with a bright pulse on “NOW,” all linked by neon network lines.
rawDictEntry: 正在 正在 [zhèng zài] /to be in the process of (doing sth); to be currently ...-ing/

meaning: To know; to be aware of; to realize or have knowledge about something (a fact, situation, or piece of information). It can also mean to find out or become aware of something.
components:
知: ⿰矢口 — 矢 (arrow) + 口 (mouth). An arrow and a mouth suggest speaking accurately, hitting the point with your words, thus ‘to know’.
道: ⿺辶首 — 辶 (walk, road, movement) + 首 (head). A head leading the way along a path, meaning ‘road, way, method’. Together, 知道 is like ‘your knowledge (知) about the way (道)’ → to know, to be aware.

examples.zh: 我知道这件事，但是不能说。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdao zhè jiàn shì, dànshì bù néng shuō.
examples.en: I know about this matter, but I can’t say anything.

examples.zh: 你知道他为什么生气吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhīdao tā wèishénme shēngqì ma?
examples.en: Do you know why he is angry?

examples.zh: 她刚刚才知道这个消息。
examples.pinyin: Tā gānggāng cái zhīdao zhège xiāoxi.
examples.en: She only just found out this news.

memoryStory: A tiny arrow (矢) flies straight into a talking mouth (口) that won’t stop spreading rumors. The shocked mouth suddenly ‘knows’ it should speak accurately. Then a giant head (首) walks along a glowing road (辶), leading everyone to the right ‘way’ of knowledge. Together they shout: “我们知道了！(We know now!)” — zhī dào!
imagePrompt: A glowing human head walking along a neon, circuit-like road through a futuristic city. Arrows of light fly into a holographic mouth, which then lights up with a bright brain-shaped network, symbolizing suddenly ‘knowing’ something. No text.
rawDictEntry: 知道 知道 [zhī dào] /to know; to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1dao]/

meaning: 准备 means to prepare, to get ready, to make preparations, to intend to do something, or to be about to do something. It can also refer to preparation work in general or reserves such as funds or materials set aside for later use.
components: “准” is 冫 (ice) on the left plus 隹 (short‑tailed bird) on the right. Imagine a bird standing very still on ice so an archer can take an accurate, ‘precise’ shot—准 carries the idea of accuracy and being ready. “备” is 夂 (a foot/going) above 田 (field). Picture someone walking around the field, checking everything and putting tools in place—fully equipped and prepared. Together, 准备 literally feels like ‘accurately equipped’ → to prepare, to get ready.

examples.zh: 我正在准备明天的考试。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèngzài zhǔnbèi míngtiān de kǎoshì.
examples.en: I am preparing for tomorrow’s exam.

examples.zh: 他们准备下个月结婚。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhǔnbèi xià gè yuè jiéhūn.
examples.en: They are planning to get married next month.

examples.zh: 出门前记得准备好护照和机票。
examples.pinyin: Chūmén qián jìdé zhǔnbèi hǎo hùzhào hé jīpiào.
examples.en: Before going out, remember to get your passport and plane ticket ready.

memoryStory: A nervous bird stands on thin ice (准), checking a holographic schedule: it’s about to perform. Below, in a glowing digital field (备), robots run around placing props. The bird shouts, “准备！准备！” as everyone frantically gets everything perfectly ready on time.
imagePrompt: A small bird standing on a glowing ice platform, checking a holographic checklist, while robots in a neon grid field below arrange tools and supplies, all in a sleek sci‑fi city with luminous network lines showing everything being made ready.
rawDictEntry: 準備 准备 [zhǔn bèi] /preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)/

meaning: Bicycle; bike — a two-wheeled vehicle that moves by human power, usually by pedaling. It can be used for transportation, exercise, or leisure. Measure word: 辆 (liàng).
components:
自 (zì): means “self, oneself.”
行 (xíng): composed of 彳 (step, walking on the left) + 亍 (small steps on the right), together suggesting movement or walking; it means “to go, to move, to travel.”
车 (chē): a pictograph of a vehicle with wheels; means “vehicle, car, cart.”

自行车 literally combines: 自 (self) + 行 (to move) + 车 (vehicle) → “a vehicle that moves by itself (your own power)” = bicycle.

examples.zh: 我每天骑自行车去上班。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān qí zìxíngchē qù shàngbān.
examples.en: I ride a bicycle to work every day.

examples.zh: 这辆自行车是新的，你要小心骑。
examples.pinyin: Zhè liàng zìxíngchē shì xīn de, nǐ yào xiǎoxīn qí.
examples.en: This bicycle is new; you should ride it carefully.

examples.zh: 周末我们一起去河边骑自行车吧。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò wǒmen yìqǐ qù hébiān qí zìxíngchē ba.
examples.en: Let’s go ride bicycles by the river this weekend.

memoryStory: Imagine a lazy CAR (车, chē) refusing to move unless someone pushes it. Suddenly, your SELF (自, zì) jumps on, and with each STEP (行, xíng) on the pedals, the car magically turns into a cool bike. You shout, “It MOVES BY ITSELF!” as you zoom away on your 自行车.
imagePrompt: A sleek bicycle made of glowing neon lines, wheels like holographic discs, riding on a transparent road above a futuristic city. Data streams and network grids connect the wheels to the sky, emphasizing motion and self-powered travel. No text.
rawDictEntry: 自行車 自行车 [zì xíng chē] /bicycle; bike/CL:輛|辆[liàng]/

meaning: 走 (zǒu) means to walk, to go, to leave or go away, to run or move (including vehicles), to visit, and in euphemistic use, to pass away. It also appears in compounds to mean ‘away’ or ‘off’ and can imply a change in shape, form, or meaning.
components: 走 is written as ⿱土龰. The top part 土 originally looks like a lump of earth or ground, suggesting the place you move on. The bottom part 龰 shows a foot and movement lines, indicating walking or stepping. Together, a foot moving on the ground gives the idea of walking/going/leaving.

examples.zh: 我先走了，你们慢慢聊。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiān zǒu le, nǐmen mànman liáo.
examples.en: I’m heading off first; you all keep chatting.

examples.zh: 公交车几点走？
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiāochē jǐ diǎn zǒu?
examples.en: What time does the bus leave?

examples.zh: 他已经走了三公里了。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng zǒu le sān gōnglǐ le.
examples.en: He has already walked three kilometers.

memoryStory: Imagine a piece of earth (土) with robotic feet (龰) suddenly growing out of it. The little chunk of ground shouts “zǒu!” in a third-tone wobble and starts walking away on its own, leaving everyone behind as the walking land literally ‘goes’ off into the distance.
imagePrompt: A small floating chunk of earth with glowing robotic feet walking off along a neon-lit path through a futuristic city, leaving light trails behind it, other stationary ground pieces watching. No text, sci‑fi style with digital networks in the sky.
rawDictEntry: 走 走 [zǒu] /to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[chè zǒu])/to change (shape, form, meaning)/

meaning: “最” is an adverb meaning “most,” “to the highest degree,” or the superlative “-est.” It goes before adjectives or verbs to mark the strongest degree (e.g., 最好 = best, 最喜欢 = like the most). With 之 (世界之最), it means “the greatest / ultimate example.”
components: 最 is written as ⿱日取. Top: 日 (sun, day, brightness). Bottom: 取 (to take, to get). You can think of it as “taking from the sun” or “taking the brightest,” hinting at reaching the highest or most extreme degree.

examples.zh: 这是我最喜欢的中文歌。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì wǒ zuì xǐhuan de Zhōngwén gē.
examples.en: This is my favorite Chinese song (the one I like the most).

examples.zh: 今天是一年中最冷的一天。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān shì yì nián zhōng zuì lěng de yì tiān.
examples.en: Today is the coldest day of the year.

examples.zh: 他是班里跑得最快的人。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì bān lǐ pǎo de zuì kuài de rén.
examples.en: He is the fastest runner in the class.

memoryStory: On a distant planet, a greedy alien wants the “most” power. He stretches up and literally “takes the sun” (日 + 取). As he grabs it, the sun screams “zuì!” in a high, sharp tone (fourth tone), because he’s gone to the absolute extreme.
imagePrompt: In a neon sci‑fi city, a tall figure stands on a skyscraper rooftop, stretching up and plucking a blazing sun from a glowing networked sky, while other tiny suns remain far below, showing that he has taken the highest, brightest one.
rawDictEntry: 㝡 最 [zuì] /variant of 最[zuì]/

meaning: ‘左边’ means the left side, the area or position to the left of something or someone. It is used to describe location or direction, similar to “on the left” or “to the left (of …)” in English.
components:
左: Written as ⿸𠂇工. The top part 𠂇 looks like an arm or hand, and 工 means “work” or “tool.” Historically, 左 is associated with the left hand used for work or assistance.
边: Written as ⿺辶力. 辶 is the “walking/movement” radical, suggesting movement, road, or path. 力 means “strength, force.” Together, 边 originally hints at moving to a side with effort, which becomes the idea of an “edge, side, border.”
Combined, 左边 literally means the “left side/edge” — the side on the left when you face forward.

examples.zh: 请把书放在桌子的左边。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ shū fàng zài zhuōzi de zuǒbian.
examples.en: Please put the book on the left side of the table.

examples.zh: 他坐在我左边，她坐在我右边。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuò zài wǒ zuǒbian, tā zuò zài wǒ yòubian.
examples.en: He sits on my left side, and she sits on my right side.

examples.zh: 地铁站在学校的左边，很近。
examples.pinyin: Dìtiě zhàn zài xuéxiào de zuǒbian, hěn jìn.
examples.en: The subway station is on the left side of the school, very close.

memoryStory: Imagine a robot worker (左: arm + tool) marching down a glowing road (辶) powered by muscle strength (力). The robot keeps shouting: “Only the LEFT SIDE is safe!” so everyone crowds to its 左边 to survive the laser traps.
imagePrompt: Futuristic city street at night, glowing neon. A person stands facing forward; on their left side a bright blue holographic arrow highlights that side. The left side is lit with cool lights, the right is dim. Subtle circuit patterns and network lines in the sky.
rawDictEntry: 左邊 左边 [zuǒ bian] /left/the left side/to the left of/
